================================================ LICENSE ================================================

For the Harvard-Oxford (HO) atlases, the CONN toolbox masks were used, and converted to bilateral masks. 

Harvard-Oxford cortical & subcortical:
Desikan RS, Ségonne F, Fischl B, Quinn BT, Dickerson BC, Blacker D, Buckner RL, Dale AM, Maguire RP, Hyman BT, 
Albert MS, Killiany RJ. 

An automated labeling system for subdividing the human cerebral cortex on MRI scans into gyral based regions of interest. 
Neuroimage. 2006 Jul 1;31(3):968-80.

1.      Cortical ROIs from FSL Harvard-Oxford Atlas maximum likelihood cortical atlas (HarvardOxford-cort-maxprob-thr25-1mm.nii); 
        divided bilateral areas into left/right hemisphere; (91 original ROIs, before making bilateral)
2.      Subcortical ROIs from FSL Harvard-Oxford Atlas maximum likelihood subcortical atlas (HarvardOxford-sub-maxprob-thr25-1mm.nii); 
        disregarded Cerebral White Matter, Cerebral Cortex, and Lateral Ventrical areas; (15 original ROIs, before making bilateral)
3.      Cerebellar parcelation from AAL Atlas (26 ROIs); this cerebellum AAL atlas was not used, since this is a difficult region with ASL, so is PM.
        note: a small percentage of voxels received labels from several of the atlases above, in those cases atlas precedence 
        Cortical>Cerebellar>Subcortical was used to resolve a unique label.

In addition to ExploreASL, the following document should be cited:
Desikan RS, Ségonne F, Fischl B, Quinn BT, Dickerson BC, Blacker D, Buckner RL, Dale AM, Maguire RP, Hyman BT, Albert MS, Killiany RJ. 
An automated labeling system for subdividing the human cerebral cortex on MRI scans into gyral based regions of interest. 
Neuroimage. 2006 Jul 1;31(3):968-80.

Cerebellum: Diedrichsen, J., Balster, J.H., Cussans, E., Ramnani, N. (2009). A probabilistic MR atlas of the human cerebellum. Neuroimage. 1-3

This cerebellar ROI was implemented in the MNI structural atlas

Thalamus: Behrens et al., Non-invasive mapping of connections between human thalamus and cortex using diffusion imaging. Nature Neuroscience 6(7):750-757 (2003)

Reference List:

1.      Desikan RS, Segonne F, Fischl B, Quinn BT, Dickerson BC, Blacker D, et al. An automated labeling system for subdividing 
        the human cerebral cortex on MRI scans into gyral based regions of interest. Neuroimage 2006; 31(3):968-980.
2.      Mazziotta J, Toga A, Evans A, Fox P, Lancaster J, Zilles K, et al. A probabilistic atlas and reference system for the human brain: 
        International Consortium for Brain Mapping (ICBM). Philos Trans R Soc Lond B Biol Sci 2001; 356(1412):1293-1322.
3.      Diedrichsen J, Balsters JH, Flavell J, Cussans E, Ramnani N. A probabilistic MR atlas of the human cerebellum. Neuroimage 2009; 46(1):39-46.


=========================================================================================================
